I previously left a negative review with many rants of where the devs are taking this game.
In hindisght yes I recommend the game.

Despite the lack of foresight, balance issues, and continued bugs....this game is fun.

For $20 the game is a steal.  It is a unique game that offers quite a bit of fun and some solid replayability.

Personally I'm struggling where the game currently is and where it's going but if you're on the fence about buying the game, you should be able to get a good 50-60 hours of play before many of these issues start bothering you as well.

This game is absolutely thrilling. I was hooked in with the couple days of free play, but bought it before that had even run out because I fell in love. I've heard amazing things about the devs, and was not disappointed. I don't care about match ups not being 'fair' since I learn and adapt with every loss far more than I do when I win. No match ever feels like wasted time. Every game is a new experience, and personally I've found I'm a far better killer than survivor. I'm just not a team player. But picking those suckers off one by one is oh. So. Satisfying.

Edit: There is an issue with survivors complaining so much that they don't win every game, calling EVERY killer OP and moaning until the devs bend to them. The game is becoming less and less scary for survivors facing killers and more about survivors being whiny little jerks making fun of inexperienced killers and flaming competent ones. I still recommend the game, but please do not join this community if you're just going to be another one of these whiny little babies. If you want to main as a survivor, don't complain when you lose. Losing is part of the game for everyone and killers being constantly nerfed because of complainers is ruining the game.

Very Enjoyable Game. I was very skeptical about picking this game up at first, however during the free weekend I got a chance to play it. It is a game with great potential and its honestly not as bad as people make it out to be. Sure it has some issues, however nothing that prevents one from having fun. The main thing that I would like to see in this game is more map diversity, more character customization (making your survivor look unique compared to other survivors) and maybe another gamemode (perhaps a mode where the survivors are trapped in a facility and the killer can activate traps as survivors attempt to find an escape).

Пытаешься помочь человеку и тебя тут же находит маньяк.
Ползешь к человеку он на тебе пару минут походит потом уходит, хотя рядом нету маньяка,
И ты умираешь в муках.
Тактика такая, выбор дверь или коллега, выбирайте всегда дверь, смысла нет спасать и так ты видишь этого человека в последний раз.
Играя в эту игру понимаешь насколько люди уроды.

Core improvements require me to update the review verdict. Based on the constant steps towards adding needed features like keybinds, joinable friends, post-game chat, and addressing the meta-game with new characters, I see this game is not doomed to go into game history as a pure cash grab. The beta feel is disappearing as major bugs, exploits, and features are fixed over time.

Dead by Daylight - это когда в команде 4 человека, но каждый сам за себя
Dead by Daylight - это когда ты помогаешь союзнику выбраться из капкана, а в итоге маньяк ловит тебя и вешает на крюк вместо него
Dead by Daylight - это когда ты умираешь на крюке, а союзники в это время ремонтируют генераторы
Dead by Daylight - это когда ты ремонтируешь последний генератор, а союзник, убегающий от маньяка, приводит его прямо к тебе, и маньяк бежит уже не за ним, а за тобой
Dead by Daylight - это когда твое сердцебиение повышается одновременно с сердцебиением персонажа
Dead by Daylight - это когда ты с оружием идешь убивать хейтеров (которых у тебя нет на YouTube, но ты прекрасно воображаешь их в лице игроков)
Dead by Daylight - это когда от маньяка можно убежать делая безумные петли по дороге
Dead by Daylight - это когда бегущий прямо - рак, нуб, новичок
Dead by Daylight - это когда маньяку необходим двойник, которого нет, ибо ворот для успешного побега двое
Dead by Daylight - это когда ты следишь, чтобы жертву не сняли с крюка, а люди этим временем чинят все генераторы и бегут к воротам
Dead by Daylight - это когда ты отошел от крюка с жертвой на 10 метров, а ей в это время помогли сбежать
Dead by Daylight - это когда ты играешь в прятки по-взрослому
Dead by Daylight - это когда поиграть с друзьями можно только в приватном лобби
Dead by Daylight - это когда тебе наконец-то пригодились школьные знания английского языка
Dead by Daylight - это когда Dead by Daylight выходит раньше, чем "Friday the 13th: The Game"
Dead by Daylight - это когда фанаты Outlast испытывают оргазм
Dead by Daylight - это когда нет надоевшего всем раннего доступа
Dead by Daylight - это когда ты покупаешь готовый продукт, полностью оправдывающий свою цену

[h1]Лучший кооперативный survival horror[/h1]  

[b]В данном обзоре я не буду затрагивать тему сетевого кода, на данный момент с ним всё ОЧЕНЬ ПЛОХО![/b] Вылеты из игровой сессии происходят регулярно, поиск игры может занимать от 5 до 20 минут, баги и зависания в самой игре также не редкость. Игра действительна требует доработки и заслуживает статуса "Early Access". Ждем и надеемся, что с будущими обновлениями и патчами всё поправят. 
  
По первым впечатлениям действительно хотелось запросить возврат средств за игру по вышеописанным причинам, да и до самой покупки очень скептически к ней относился, пересмотрев несколько видеороликов и полноценных стримов, желания поиграть в неё абсолютно не возникало. И вот, буквально на днях, состоялась акция "FREE WEEKEND", по случаю выхода нового бесплатного дополнения "The Last Breath Chapter", и 15% скидкой на саму игру, я всё же решился опробовать данный продукт.
   
Слегка войдя во вкус, я ощутил, насколько эта игра проработана в плане геймплея, такого трепетного отношения разработчиков к игре, я не помню со времен The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt. Разных "тонкостей" в игре полно, их просто невозможно перечислить, опишу лишь основные моменты. В игре практически не задействован интерфейс с подсказками [spoiler](это я сейчас про радар с уровнем обнаружения аля metal gear или hitman)[/spoiler], необходимо действовать почти интуитивно,  ориентируясь лишь по звукам и окружению. Например, шорох в кустах, бег, открытие ящиков и дверей, -могут легко выдать местоположение преследуемых. Самого преследователя в игре выдает нарастающий звук ударов сердца, но его легко спутать с собственным сердцебиением, особенно когда маньяк проходит мимо и ты даже не знаешь - заметил ли он тебя или нет. В этом плане Dead by Daylight можно назвать целым симулятором выживания. 
  
Игра дает невероятные по силе чувства такого необычного страха, держит в напряжении и неуютном дискомфорте. Объективно, по такому описанию игра очень смахивает на других типичных представителей жанра survival horror, по типу  Slender, Amnesia или Outlast, но суть то в том, что за маньяка играет реальный человек и повадки у него не  запрограммированного бота, а реального человека.
 
Прочий фан-сервис к игре тоже просто прекрасен. Различные арты из прилагаемого артбука демонстрируют очень основательный подход к воссозданию слэшер-атмосферы из фильмов ужасов. Саундтрек более чем великолепен, простой и одновременно очень душевный мотив, который так и хочется набренчать на гитаре, [spoiler](жаль не умею)[/spoiler]. А сюжет в игру не завезли, вернее он есть, передается через описание разных предметов и способностей, только вот глубокого лора как в Dark Souls ждать совершенно не стоит. Всё же, если бы Dead by Daylight была фильмом, то это была бы очень провальная задумка, сравнимая с "Резня пневматическим молотком (1985)". Может именно поэтому летсплеи по этой игре не приносят так много удовольствия [strike](можно подумать, летсплеи вообще кому-то приносят удовольствие)[/strike], всё же в это нужно поиграть лично самому.  

[b]Dead by Daylight однозначно лучше схожих с ней игр - Dead Realm и Evolve. Настоятельно рекомендую к покупке, особенно если вам нравится жанр киношных слэшер-ужастиков, и если даже приобретать не сейчас, то определенно на какой-нибудь хэллоуиновской распродаже, к тому времени может и существующие неисправности починят.[/b]

Dead by Daylight is an excellent multiplayer experience.  Playing a frantic, nearly helpless victim versus one of the most unpredictable and relentless enemies you can face:  another player.  Armed with horrible weapons, every hiding place, panicked chase, or merciless killing is packed with raw terror and emotion.  My hands sweat and I can't look away from the screen as I try and find the killer.  Dead by Daylight is definitely a must play game, especially with friends!

its pretty good now.

I personally love this game. 

That said: There have been intermittent matchmaking issues, but the devs have been addressing them pretty quickly as they can. The devs are actively listening to their player audience and striving to make this the best game they can. It's definitely a work in progress, but the gameplay is something good and unique to me and i'm able to overlook its issues because of it as they work to improve.  A lot of people want to expect a AAA title out of this because it looks so polished, but look at the price tag. For an indie studio to make this kind of game is pretty damn impressive. Pretty sure that the new friday the 13th game will be good, but this game has sucked me in for the meantime. I even wound up making a bunch of online friends playing this game.

Jan 2017:
SUMMARY: This game is not competitive material but the devs insist upon it being competitive, which has led to terrible design decisions and an overall lackluster game that represents the idea of a game that could be much, much better. Design choices gleaned from much better pvp games were hamhandedly and forcibly implemented. These choices are incredibly confusing and the result of which can be seen in the "open menu" section of the lobby, where there's like a skill tree that is really more of a loot tree, an inventory that is.. I really don't have words for what in the hell this is, and a perks menu which is equally confusing. Wtf is going on here?


Gameplay isn't very deep but it's functional, visuals are acceptable. The only reason to play this game would be to play with friends. It has great potential as a fun horror game but that idea is entirely abandoned in favor of tedious "competition" gameplay mechanics. Even IF this game was competitive in any tangible way it wouldn't matter because matchmaking is fucked up. Additionally, the maps and characters are so very boring.

Overall this game is as "ok" was a game can get. Everything it is, is underwhelming. Major problems that aren't being addressed and will absolutely contribute to this game being forgetten in the next year:

-In order to be a killer in matchmaking you have to be alone, which would be fine in any other game, however, most people including myself bought ths game *with friends* and intend to play it *with friends*. This evolves into a second problem:

-I play this game with friends because it's not fun enough for me to want to play it alone (and everyone I've played it with would agree), killing my friends in a custom game is fun but you can't earn anything that way. Killing random people is boring. Even when I succeed it's just fucking boring, mainly because..

-Killer gameplay consists only of "see person, get person, put person in place, repeat". Patience isn't rewarded as much as brute force is, there's barely any options, if any at all. Players can't even jump. You could play this game after downing a bottle of xanax and the results would be similar, only you might not be bored.

-You can earn special items to use in matchmaking multiplayer games that you only can earn from matchmaking multiplayer games. These items and perks give you huge advantages *if you have them*. If not then go fuck yourself.

-This game could have really cool maps and environments but instead every level is the same, flat, boring pac-man labrynth of random junk. You also cannot jump. Not that it would make the game any better if you could. Speaking of boring, killing people could not possibly be more boring.

-Matchmaking times are ASTRONOMICAL. Ever waited 20 minutes for a match in any game ever? No? Me either.That's far too fucking long for a game I enjoy, much less a game that I feel completely ambivalent to (or did until I waited an hour).

-Seriously, why are FOUR people waiting for ONE person in matchmaking for 15 fucking minutes, just let one of us be the killer. Who gives a fuck if we farm XP this game shouldn't be competitive in the first fucking place.

-Lastly, rubberbanding issues, input lag issues, fail to join game and lobby connection bugs are prevelant and obvious. It took me and 3 friends like a half an hour to figure our shit out and get the game working, and by that I mean we gave up and started a custom game. Why did I buy this?

Why the fuck does anyone play this

This game is not perfect by any means, but it can be a lot of fun if you are willing to look past the flaws. Surviving can be a very intense experience, although the gameplay itself is a little plain, as it is really easy to give your position away to the killer and you have to remember that you are hiding from a real person. Killing is concerningly fun, as there is this primal joy that you feel when you start chasing people around with a chainsaw. Imagine any slasher movie killer, and think from the mindset of a deranged psychopathic killer, and you will have a blast while also being concerned for your own humanity.

All of the Killers have their own unique ability such as going invisible, teleporting, or running really really fast with a chainsaw that can 1HKO. It sounds overpowered, but they all have a weakness that can be exploited by the survivors to help them get away, so you have to learn the correct time to use them. The Survivors and the Killers also have their own unique perks that can be unlocked through a random skill progression system. The perks give you all sorts of abilities that help emphasize different ways of playing.

The bad part of the game is that the gameplay itself is REALLY simple, so it can have it's dull moments. The real fun of the game is hunting down survivors, or trying to not get killed. The game is also very glitchy, although it has slowly gotten better with time and lots of patches. The game did not initially come with some very key features like key rebinding and friend matchmaking, but those are all in now, so don't believe the other reviews that say that they aren't there, although it is in in a very basic form at the moment. There are a lot of matchmaking issues, but they are being fixed, and it used to be so much worse.

The game is not perfect, but if you are patient with it and want to enjoy a unique type of fun that you don't get to experience in other games too often, then I would highly recommend trying this out. It's only $20, which isn't much for games these days, and it is constantly growing and evolving.

It's a steaming hot mess with not even a slight attempt at polishing done. Consistent bugs and crashes, usually during a match which, for a while, would actually result in the killer winning and you getting nothing if you were a survivor. No balancing attempted AT ALL, and the "tools" you're given to help you win are, for the most part, useless, and the skills given to you in the bloodweb, even when maxed, are kind of shit. Fun with friends, terrible otherwise.
Oh, and you know the creepy ambience you hear? It's generated -just- outside of the walls, and its placement is extremely noticable while sneaking along the wall, which you're going to be doing a lot of.

Writing this review now to tell everyone that the developers have pushed out a patch that kills dead lobbies and thus makes it easier to find a match, at least in my case. It's something I see many people point out and complain about.

So, the game's fun, the concept of a killer trying to brutally murder a bunch of teenagers is simple, yet extremely fun and intense. Problem is, the game's a bit wonky. It has some bugs that can be quite frustrating while playing, the devs are actively updating the game though and are making sure everything runs as smooth as it should be.

What you're essentially doing in this game is, you have a group of four survivors and you're trying to  escape the map by trying to activate generators, while the killer is trying to sacrifice all survivors to the so called 'Entity'. 

The game provides hiding spots and cover for survivors, who need to sneak around and try to avoid the killer. An interesting part about this game is that the survivors play in third person, while the killer plays in first person. This is because it makes it easier for the survivors to spot the killer, while the killer might be suffering from intense tunnel vision and walk straight past his targets.

After each game you will earn so called 'Bloodpoints', a sort of currency you can spend on items, perks and offerings that you can use in the game. All killers and survivors have different 'Blood webs', a sort of skill tree. This means that all characters have unique skills that can be used in the game.

Do I recommend this game? Yeah, I do. It's fun, especially if you have a group of friends to play with. I also feel like that fate of this game is in the hands of some good developers, who host a weekly Q&A stream on their twitch to interact with the community and develop the game further. I suggest you give this game a try, it's a really cool experience.

i dont recommend anyone to buy this game right now, its a buggy mess and developers have no idea what they are doing. They keep ruining the game by making changes nobody ask or want for. Save your money
fickle minds ain't we?

I used to think this game was a complete mess, even after reading about all the problems with it, I still decided to give it a fair chance, but even so it's just so bad. I do enjoy playing with friends, but it can be boring when playing alone. The controls are alright, the graphics are alright, but my problem with it stems from the options menu (or lack there of), there aren't enough display options, the maps are too dark (would like some gamma/brightness options, but according to the dev's they would find it to be a cheat of sorts), and everything blends together. The animations are too slow at times for my taste, and half of the time it feels like nothing is going on in the map, its troubling enough to find people through the map (noting that it's not because people are good at hiding, just too hard to see anything). The music is repetitive as well, but I mean the game looks cool and that's about it. There are also not nearly as many running options for the killer as there are for the survivors, but I can say the killers are unique in their own right. 

The last thing I can touch on is the fact that it is slowly becoming more and more of a controversial paid promotion game, which there lacks creativity, some find it cool but I want more original killers as well. I think this game is a gamble, you pay for what you get, but the DLC is where a lot of people go to when bringing up the game. As of the Pinhead chapter there has been controversy regarding NFT's on a platform that has actually banned that type of business model, while I understand that people will still play this game because it has become one of those "streamer game" titles, the developers only care about taking your money. If you want to spend your money on this game, it's your money, but I would wait for a sale because this game is a hard pass for me in terms of recommending.

tl;dr
[b]Nie kupuj, nie warto. Zamiast brać DBD, lepiej zaczekać na Resident Evil 3 Resistance.[/b]

[h1]Czym jest Dead by Daylight?[/h1]
To do tej pory jedyny popularny tytuł w klimacie horroru z asymetrycznym PvP.
W meczu bierze udział pięciu graczy. Jeden jest zabójcą, pozostali muszą naprawić pięć generatorów i przedostać się do wyjścia.
DBD oferuje killerów oryginalnych jak i licencjonowanych, takich jak np. Freddy Krueger czy Michael Myers.

[h1]Co jest dobrego w BDB?[/h1]
[list]
[*]przez pierwsze 60h oferuje dobry klimat i elementy grozy
[*]spory wybór przeżytków i zabójców
[*]aktywnie rozwijany tytuł z regularnymi chapterami
[*]oferuje możliwość odblokowania skilli bez wydawania kasy na DLC
[*]Polska lokalizacja
[/list]

[h1]Co jest złego w BDB?[/h1]
[list]
[*]gra jest słabo zbalansowana i wydaje się, że dev team przestał panować nad rozgrywką
[*]pełno błędów, od niedziałających umiejętności po wizualne glitche
[*]dedykowane serwery są w średnim stanie, a lagi wypaczają to co widać na ekranie
[*]matchmaking - długi czas oczekiwania na gry, a dodatkowo ignorowany jest poziom umiejętności graczy
[*]choć jest kilka ciekawych skinów postaci, większość różni się zaledwie kolorem materiału
[*]grind XP ponad przyjemność z grania
[*]wysoce toksyczna społeczność i griefing (za co nie ma kar)
[*]niekompetentny support i moderatorzy (poza wklejaniem automatycznych odpowiedzi, nie rozwiązują problemów)
[/list]

Dead by Daylight początkowo przyciąga, a poznawanie gry jest świetne. Tak jest do momentu, gdy zaczniesz trafiać do pokoi z bardziej zaawansowanymi graczami. Bardzo mały procent gra na luzie, większość nie dość, że zrobi wszystko żeby wygrać, to często będzie próbować ograniczyć twoje punkty - nawet, gdy należy do twojej drużyny.

[b]Developer na feedback osób, które spędziły w grze 1k godzin i więcej, odpowiada, że powinni dla odmiany zagrać w Cywilizację czy inna grę - tyle na ten temat.[/b]

Mam wbite ponad 1000h, choć sporo tego czasu spędziłem robiąc inne rzeczy, czekając aż gra znajdzie wolny serwer.
Gra wciąga, ale rozkład satysfakcji do skrajnej frustracji przedstawia się w relacji 30/70.

[b]Nie tyle co odradzam, co ostrzegam, bo czasem szkoda czasu, nerwów i energii.[/b]
